body: @virajjasani Do you mean that if my submitted PR has been reviewed and approved by other committers or PMC members, I can merge this PR myself and update the related issue?
Absolutely :)

> @virajjasani Ambari CI/CD has been down for a long time and I need your help to fix the CI/CD issues of Ambari. Usually, the Jenkins configuration files are included in the project to allow contributors to modify the CI/CD configurations. To ensure the smooth operation of Ambari's CI/CD in the future, here is my plan: Could you please send me the Ambari CI/CD files to my Google email [jialiangcaimd@gmail.com](mailto:jialiangcaimd@gmail.com) ? I'll set up a local CI/CD environment to reproduce and fix the issues, and then I will need your help to update the CI/CD configuration for Ambari online. I will create a PR to include the Jenkins configuration files in the Ambari project. Also, I need your assistance to configure the Ambari CI/CD environment so that it reads the Jenkins configuration files maintained within the Ambari project.

@virajjasani 
I have already obtained the Jenkins configuration files and set up a Jenkins environment locally. I am currently in the process of reproducing and fixing the issue. Thank you for your help.
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8bd43dc8-27ae-4c70-976d-353e22a77e8c)
Awesome, thank you so much for your dedication!

@virajjasani  Could you help review this PR ?  Once this PR is merged, my plan is to further modify the Jenkins configuration to use the Jenkinsfile from the project repository. This approach will provide version control for subsequent Jenkinsfile modifications, making it easier to rollback changes if issues arise.
Sounds good, thank you once again!

> requested them to submit a PR to address the CI/CD failure caused by their code changes.

Thank you very much for your ongoing support. Your backing in our community work has been a significant motivator for me to keep pushing forward.
LGTM +1
The branch has updated, CC@JiaLiangC
hi, @JiaLiangC , I added the test case to ambari agent unittests.

@vivostar  since I'm not very familiar with the functionality you've submitted, it might take me some time to perform local testing.
@echohlne Could you make a pr based trunk branch?

@echohlne Hello, I've noticed that some of the issues from the PRs you closed also exist in the trunk branch. Would it be possible to submit a version based on the trunk branch? I'd be happy to help review it.
@virajjasani Could you help review this pr ?
Given that daziz has not been active and does not have an Ambari issue account, I have already helped create and link the corresponding issue. https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMBARI-26104
I have already helped create and link the corresponding issue.
@raboof Thank you for your contribution.
Nice, thanks @JiaLiangC
cc @JiaLiangC
@virajjasani This is quite a substantial PR aimed at unifying the Python interpreter headers. Do you have any thoughts or insights on this?

Indeed this is huge PR. Thanks for working on this @zRains.

Curious what would be the testing approach here? We want to make sure that we are not breaking anything.
@zRains Could you help review this pr? You're more familiar with the frontend.

@virajjasani The added interpreter declarations may not be used and generally have little side effect. Since Python 3 is already supported in #3751 we can safely replace the declarations. All changes have passed the [tests](https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/blue/organizations/jenkins/Ambari%2FAmbari-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/detail/PR-3799/8/pipeline).
@zRains The libraries are tightly coupled with each other. Upgrade of jquery would require upgrade of bootstrap as with the newer version of jquery, old bootstrap is not supported.
@zRains The testing team in the organisation has pointed out some UI deviations as well which will be raised as tickets on the board once this PR is merged.
@vanshuhassija Could u resolve conflict?
@xijunmu  good catch, thanks
@JiaLiangC  Could you help review this PR?
@zRains do I need to (manually) backport this to any other branch (like branch-2.8) once this is merged into the trunk?
@prabhjyotsingh No need, just apply it to the trunk branch. Thank you for your contribution.
@zRains I seem to be missing write access on Gitbox. Could you help me merge this?
@JiaLiangC Your turn.
Sounds good. Let me take a look today. @JiaLiangC you can also take a look in the meantime.
LGTM +1 @zRains thanks for help reviewing  @prabhjyotsingh thanks for you work

> Sounds good. Let me take a look today. @JiaLiangC you can also take a look in the meantime.
The modifications look fine. All the modified code has Python unit tests, and everything is covered. I think it's OK.

Hi @JiaLiangC , attached the doc in this jira https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMBARI-26073. I have completed the frontend + backend implementation of the approach mentioned here. Requesting your feedback on the same. I will be raising separate PRs by EOD tomorrow. 
Thanks!
@JiaLiangC Could you help review this pr?
@JiaLiangC Could you help review this PR?
@vanshuhassija Could you please resolve this conflict first? After that, other community members can continue to push forward with the work on upgrading the frontend components.

> This issue indeed exists. It was caused by the merge of this PR: #3656. When testing the Ambari agent installation of components locally, it results in an error. Thank you for your fix. It would be even better if you could attach screenshots of the error message before the fix and the log output after the fix.

I can't find the screenshot anymore. I think this issue can be resolved without the need for a screenshot

@LiJie20190102 Because many fixes cannot be covered by unit tests alone, if no screenshots or other information are provided in the "How to Test" section, it makes it very difficult for reviewers. I hope you can understand this.

> @LiJie20190102 Because many fixes cannot be covered by unit tests alone, if no screenshots or other information are provided in the "How to Test" section, it makes it very difficult for reviewers. I hope you can understand this.

I completely understand what you mean, and next time I will keep the relevant screenshots
@JiaLiangC , @virajjasani , please help review this PR
@JiaLiangC , @virajjasani , please help review this pr.
@AnanyaSingh2121 please fix CI/CD failure

> Can we change the router configuration without having to restart the entire HDFS cluster? The cost of restarting the cluster is significant, whereas the cost of restarting the router is minimal.

You are correct, we should not restart the HDFS cluster with any config change for Router. I have tried to make sure of that in my code. I have added some comment in my code

- https://github.com/apache/ambari/pull/3804/files#r1708682170
- https://github.com/apache/ambari/pull/3804/files#r1708685015
Please review these. I tested with these and the restart was not required.

> @AnanyaSingh2121 please fix CI/CD failure

sure @JiaLiangC

> > @AnanyaSingh2121 please fix CI/CD failure
>

CI/CD is fixed now , had to add one test
@zRains Could you help review this?

> LGTM, thank you for your contribution!

Thank you @JiaLiangC for reviewing and merging.

@arshadmohammad I remember you previously handled a PR related to PhantomJS. Have you already installed PhantomJS in the Ambari Jenkins environment? Can you explain the PhantomJS environment configuration work you did before? The frontend team needs to move forward, and we need to install PhantomJS in the Jenkins environment."

@virajjasani Hello,I have created some scripts to check if Chromium is installed on our servers. I discovered that the Jenkins server does not have this service installed. 

How can we request the Jenkins team or relevant personnel to install Chromium on the Jenkins server?

This installation is necessary for our frontend service to test properly. Could you please advise on the best way to proceed with this request?

Thank you for your assistance.

This PR had removed the PhantomJS. No CI change was done for this PR.  
As far as I know, PhantomJS is automatically downloaded while building the ambari. No sure if there is specific setting required for PhantomJS.
@arshadmohammad I apologize for the slip of the tongue earlier, I meant Chromium browser, not PhantomJS.

No CI change was done for Chromium browser. 
@vanshuhassija do you have anything to share on what packages need to be installed on CI environment for Chromium browser.
We can create INFRA Jira I believe.
Once the Jira is created, we can also post on asfinfra channel in ASF slack https://the-asf.slack.com/archives/CBX4TSBQ8/p1723380330362469

I have tested it on my local dev enviroment. 
![test_stomp_server](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/92fb954d-c5b9-4683-80f5-315d75b9f135)
cc @JiaLiangC

@arshadmohammad @JiaLiangC No CI changes were done for ChromeHeadless. The CI ran as expected without defining custom ChromeHeadless sandbox behaviour. Simply specifying ChromeHeadless as the browser worked for me.
@JiaLiangC The PR has no conflicts with the base branch. Any specific conflict you are referring to?

Very thanks for your help!

>

OK

@arshadmohammad @vanshuhassija Thank you for the information you provided. I wrote a Jenkins script to test whether the Jenkins environment has Chromium, and the conclusion is that it doesn't. You can find the script at https://github.com/apache/ambari/pull/3810. I have already submitted an issue to the ASF infra team, and we're now waiting for them to process it and install Chromium in the Jenkins environment.

@vanshuhassija Regarding this PR, I have concerns because it involves extensive changes. After applying this PR in the test environment, I noticed several bugs in the frontend. I'm worried that if we merge it, the community might not have enough frontend developers and contributors to address these issues. This could lead to many bugs remaining unresolved before the release. That's my main concern.
@newyyshan thanks for your contribution, the ci failed due to no jira id found, that means you need create a releated issue first ,and change your pr title with Issue id AMBARI-xxx

Have you tried Python 3.9? Python 3.9 doesn't seem to have this issue. If we use the code you submitted and we use Python 3.9, the ambari-agent cannot start properly.    
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/be1cf74d-7936-445e-9b0f-7da2bdb8d61c)

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/68b43c8b-b384-4b28-9328-3ce911c7b109)
@LiJie20190102 thanks for your feedback, i will revert this pr.
@LiJie20190102 Thanks, Ambari Agent use the websocket protocol to transfer messaage. I think I should more carefully to change amabari-common module code.
@JiaLiangC Could you help review this PR?
Looks like jenkins build failed?

Hello @prabhjyotsingh @JiaLiangC @zRains I have applied this pull request as a patch on Ambari 2.7.8.0. "Dashboard, Services, Hosts, Alerts, Cluster Admin" pages seem to be fixed after the patch. However, "Manage Ambari" pages (Cluster Management, Users, Views) still seem to have this issue. I am new to open-source, so I do not know the exact procedure to report such a thing. Shall I sign up and open a ticket at Ambari Jira, or sign up and write a comment on https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMBARI-26107 , or is this comment adequate itself. Thanks in advance.
@omer-ege-ozkaya It seems that you haven't applied this patch, `DOMNodeInserted` has been completely removed.

Hi @zRains 

I guess the issue is that the `DOMNodeInserted` persisting not in the `ambari-web` module, but in the `ambari-admin` module.

`ambari/ambari-admin/src/main/resources/ui/admin-web/app/scripts/controllers/SideNavCtrl.js
`
https://github.com/apache/ambari/blob/411be3ada1a52859bf22e48794f347e7b19b8cec/ambari-admin/src/main/resources/ui/admin-web/app/scripts/controllers/SideNavCtrl.js#L38
@omer-ege-ozkaya sure let me taka a look at it, and create another PR.
Thank you @prabhjyotsingh looking forward to it
@omer-ege-ozkaya try this patch, and it should work.
cc @JiaLiangC
Everything is working fine now, thanks @prabhjyotsingh !

Recommended Node.js Versions:
Node.js 12.x to 16.x:

karma-chrome-launcher 3.2.0 works well with Node.js versions from 12.x to 16.x. These versions are also commonly supported by many other dependencies in the JavaScript ecosystem.

@virajjasani Could you help review this pr ?    The pull request at https://github.com/apache/ambari/pull/3809 needs to modify the Jenkinsfile first. However, I do not have the permissions to make the Jenkinsfile effective. Therefore, I am submitting this pull request to help move https://github.com/apache/ambari/pull/3809 forward.
